info.title: Voice API | Sinch
info.description: The Voice API exposes calling- and conference-related functionality in the Sinch Voice Platform.

servers.description: redirected by Sinch to an appropriate region

post.description:
When a call reaches the Sinch platform, the system makes a POST request to the specified calling callback URL.

This event, called the **ICE** event, can be triggered by either an incoming data call or an incoming PSTN call. Look here for allowed [instructions](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/instructions) and [actions](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/actions).

If there is no response to the callback within the timeout period, an error message is played, and the call is disconnected.

200.description: The Incoming Call Event (ICE) requires a valid SVAML object in response.

post.description: This callback is made when the call is picked up by the callee (person receiving the call). It's a POST request to the specified calling callback URL. Look here for allowed [instructions](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/instructions) and [actions](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/actions). If there is no response to the callback within the timeout period, the call is connected. If you have [Answering Machine Detection](/docs/voice/api-reference/amd_v2) (AMD) enabled, the `amd` object will also be present on ACE callbacks. Note: ACE Callbacks are not issued for InApp Calls (`destination:` `username`), only PSTN and SIP calls.

200.description: The Answered Call Event (ACE) requires a valid SVAML object in response.

post.description: This callback is made when the call is disconnected. It's a POST request to the specified calling callback URL. This event doesn't support instructions and only supports the [hangup](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/actions/#hangup) action.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.description: This callback is triggered as a result of a [runMenu](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/actions/#runmenu) action. It can be triggered from either a user pressing a number of DTMF digits, or by the `return` command. It's a POST request to the specified calling callback URL. Your application can respond with [SVAML](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/) logic. Note: PIE callbacks are not issued for DATA Calls, only PSTN and SIP calls.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.description:
This is the general callback used to send notifications. It's a POST request to the specified calling callback URL.

If there is no response to the callback within the timeout period, the notification is discarded.

200.description: Return a 200 status to indicate that the data was received successfully

post.description: Makes a call out to a phone number. The types of callouts currently supported are conference callouts, text-to-speech callouts, and custom callouts. The custom callout is the most flexible, but text-to-speech and conference callouts are more convenient.

patch.description:
This method is used to manage ongoing, connected calls. This method uses SVAML in the request body to perform various tasks related to the call. For more information about SVAML, see the [Callback API](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/) documentation.

This method can only be used for calls that originate from or terminate to PSTN or SIP networks.

get.description:
You can retrieve information about an ongoing or completed call using a call ID. You can find the call ID of an ongoing call by viewing the response object from a callout request. You can find the call ID of a completed call by looking at your call logs in your Sinch [Dashboard](https://dashboard.sinch.com/voice/logs).

Note: You can only use this method for calls that terminate to PSTN or SIP networks from an In-app call.

patch.description:
This method is used to manage ongoing, connected calls. This method is only used when using the `PlayFiles` and `Say` instructions in the request body. This method uses SVAML in the request body to perform various tasks related to the call. For more information about SVAML, see the [Callback API](/docs/voice/api-reference/svaml/) documentation.

Note: You can only use this method for calls that originate from or terminate to PSTN or SIP networks.

instructions.name: say
instructions.text: Hello, the call is over, hanging up now.  Goodbye

get.description: Returns information about a conference that matches the provided conference ID.

delete.description: Removes all participants from a conference.

patch.description:
Manages conference participant in a specified conference:
* mute / unmute
* put on hold / resume.

delete.description: Remove a specified conference participant from a specified conference.

get.description: Get information about your numbers. It returns a list of numbers that you own, as well as their capability (voice or SMS). For the ones that are assigned to an app, it returns the application key of the app.

post.description: Assign a number or a list of numbers to an application.

delete.description: Un-assign a number from an application.

get.description: Returns any callback URLs configured for the specified application.

post.description: Update the configured callback URLs for the specified application.

get.description: Returns information about the requested number.

Basic.description: For more information about basic authentication, see [Basic Authentication](/docs/voice/api-reference/authentication#basic-authentication).

Signed.description: For more information about signed request authentication, see [Request Signing](/docs/voice/api-reference/authentication/signed-request).

confCalloutRequest.summary: Add a participant to a conference

ttsCalloutRequestCall.description: Place a phone call and use text to speech to convey a message.

ttsCallout.text: Hello, this is a call from Sinch.

ttsCalloutRequestPrompt.description: Place a phone call and use text to speech with SSML to convey a message.

ttsCallout.prompts:
#ssml[

Your PIN code is 1234

Please enter it now

]

ttsCalloutRequestPlayFile.summary: Play a prompt with an external file
ttsCalloutRequestPlayFile.description: Place a phone call and use text to speech via an external file to convey a message. Please review the [External media support ](/docs/voice/api-reference/supported-audio-formats) page for Caching, Limits and Content-Type headers information.

customCalloutRequest.description: An example of a custom callout to invoke an ICE and ACE request

customCallout.ace: {"instructions": [{"name": "say", "text": "Hello, this is a call from Sinch!"}], "action": {"name": "hangup"}}

customCalloutAMDRequest.summary: Make a custom callout that enables AMD
customCalloutAMDRequest.description: An example of a custom callout that uses an ICE request to enable Answering Machine Detection

ICEexample.description: An example of an Incoming Call Event.

DICEexample.description: An example of a Disconnected Call Event.

PIEexample.description: An example of a Prompt Input Event.

NotifyRecordingFinishedExample.description: An example of a Notify Event that a recording is finished.

NotifyRecordingAvailableExample.description: An example of a Notify Event that a recording is available for download.

AceHangupResponse.description: A SVAML response to an Answered Call Event that plays a message to the callee and then hangs up the call.

instructions.name: say
instructions.text: This is a call from Sinch. This call will now end.

AcePlayMenuResponse.description: A SVAML response to an Answered Call Event that plays a menu to the callee.

menus.mainPrompt: #tts[This is the main menu. Press 1 for support or 2 to continue to the next menu.]
#tts[This is the sub menu. Enter your 4-digit PIN]

IceSayResponse.description: A SVAML response to an Incoming Call Event that plays a message to the caller and then hangs up the call.

instructions.name: say
instructions.text: Thank you for calling Sinch! This call will now end.

Authorization header missing, illegal or invalid

Privileges are insufficient to access the resource
The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current resource
The number of requests has exceeded capacity
The number of requests has exceeded velocity constraint
General error; try submitting request again

menus.mainPrompt: #tts[Welcome to the main menu. Press 1 for support or 2 to continue.]
#tts[Welcome to the sub menu. Enter your 4-digit PIN.]

action.name: park
action.holdPrompt: #tts[Thank you for your patience, your call is very important to us.]

instructions.name: say
instructions.text: Hello, this is a text-to-speech message.

number.name: number
number.description: The phone number you want to query.

callId.name: callId
callId.description: The unique identifier of the call. This value is generated by the system.

conferenceId.name: conferenceId
conferenceId.description: The unique identifier of the conference. The user sets this value.

applicationkey.name: applicationkey
applicationkey.description: The unique identifying key of the application.

callLeg.name: callLeg
callLeg.description: Specifies which part of the call will be managed. This option is used only by the `PlayFiles` and `Say` instructions to indicate which channel the sound will be played on. Valid options are `caller`, `callee` or `both`. If not specified, the default value is `caller`.</br><Warning>The `callLeg` identifier is ignored for calls that are part of a conference and calls initiated using the Callout API.</Warning>

type.name: type
type.description: The type of endpoint on which you want to report. The value can be either `number` or `username`.

endpoint.name: endpoint
endpoint.description: The value of the endpoint of the call. For calls on the PSTN, this is a phone number. For app-to-app calls, this is a username.

domain.name: domain
domain.description: An optional parameter that specifies the terminating pattern. Can be either `data` or `pstn`.

id.name: id
id.description: A predefined ID string. This must be set up in cooperation with the Sinch support team.

status.description: A summary of the HTTP error code and error type.

message.description: A simple description of the cause of the error.

reference.description: If applicable, a reference ID for support to use with diagnosing the error.

destination.description: The type of device and number or endpoint to call.

type.description: Can be of type `number` for PSTN endpoints or of type `username` for data endpoints.

endpoint.description: If the type is `number` the value of the endpoint is a phone number. If the type is `username` the value is the username for a data endpoint.

numbers.description: The phone number or list of numbers in E.164 format.

applicationkey.description: indicates the application where the number(s) will be assigned. If empty, the application key that is used to sign the request will be used.

capability.description: indicates the DID capability that needs to be assigned to the chosen application. Valid values are 'voice' and 'sms'. Please note that the DID needs to support the selected capability.

number.description: The phone number in E.164 format (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/E.164)

applicationkey.description: Indicates the application where the number(s) was assigned. If empty, the application key that is used to sign the request will be used.

capability.description: (optional) indicates the DID capability that was assigned to the chosen application. Please note that the DID needs to support the selected capability.

callId.description: The unique identifier of the call.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

status.description: The status of the call. Either `ONGOING` or `FINAL`

result.description: Contains the result of a call.

reason.description: Contains the reason why a call ended.

timestamp.description: The date and time of the call.

custom.description: An object that can be used to pass custom information related to the call.

userRate.description: The rate per minute that was charged for the call.

debit.description: The total amount charged for the call.

url.description: Gets primary and if configured fallback callback URLs

fallback.description: Your fallback callback URL (returned if configured). It is used only if Sinch platform gets a timeout or error from your primary callback URL.

url.description: Contains primary and or fallback callback URLs

restricted.description: Concerns whether the call is restricted or not.

rate.description: The cost per minute to call the destination number.

currencyId.description: The currency ID of the rate, for example, `USD`.

numbers.description: The object type. Will always be list of numbers, associated application keys and capabilities

number.description: Numbers that you own in E.164 format.

applicationkey.description: Indicates the application where the number(s) will be assigned. If no number is assigned the applicationkey will not be returned.

capability.description: indicates the DID capability that needs to be assigned to the chosen application. Valid values are 'voice' and 'sms'. Please note that the DID needs to support the selected capability.

getConferenceInfoResponse.description: The response returns information about the participants in the conference.

cli.description: The phone number of the PSTN participant that was connected in the conference, or whatever was passed as CLI for data originated/terminated calls.

id.description: The callId of the call leg that the participant joined the conference.

duration.description: The number of seconds that the participant has been connected to the conference.

command.description: Action to apply on conference participant.

moh.description: Means "music on hold". If this optional parameter is included, plays music to the first participant in a conference while they're alone and waiting for other participants to join. If `moh` isn't specified, the user will only hear silence while alone in the conference. This property is only available to use with the `onhold` command.

CalloutRequest.description: Currently three types of callouts are supported: conference callouts, text-to-speech callouts and custom callouts. The custom callout is the most flexible, but text-to-speech and conference callouts are more convenient.

conferenceCalloutRequest.description: The conference callout calls a phone number or a user. When the call is answered, it's connected to a conference room.

cli.description: The number that will be displayed as the incoming caller. To set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard number. The number must be in [E.164](https://community.sinch.com/t5/Glossary/E-164/ta-p/7537) format.

conferenceId.description: The conferenceId of the conference to which you want the callee to join. If the conferenceId doesn't exist a conference room will be created.

conferenceDtmfOptions.description: Options to control how DTMF signals are used by the participant in the conference. For information on how to use this feature, read more [here](../../../conference-dtmf).

mode.description: Determines what DTMF mode the participant will use in the call.

x-enumDescriptions.ignore: Nothing is done with the participant's DTMF signals. This is the default mode. Any DTMF signals that the participant sends can still be heard by all participants, but no action will be performed.
x-enumDescriptions.forward: The participant's DTMF signals are forwarded to all other participants in the conference.
x-enumDescriptions.detect: The participant's DTMF signals are detected by the conference and sent to your backend server using a [Prompt Input Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/pie) (PIE) callback.

maxDigits.description:
The maximum number of accepted digits before sending the collected input via a PIE callback. The default value is `1`. If the value is greater than `1`, the PIE callback is triggered by one of the three following events:
  - No additional digit is entered before the `timeoutMills` timeout period has elapsed.
  - The `#` character is entered.
  - The maximum number of digits has been entered.

timeoutMills.description: The number of milliseconds that the system will wait between entered digits before triggering the PIE callback. The default value is `3000`.

dtmf.description: When the destination picks up, this DTMF tones will be played to the callee. Valid characters in the string are "0"-"9", "#" and "w". A "w" will render a 500 ms pause. Example: "ww1234#w#" will render a 1s pause, the DTMF tones "1", "2", "3", "4" and "#" followed by a 0.5s pause and finally the DTMF tone for "#". This can be used if the callout destination for instance require a conference PIN code or an extension to be entered.

enableAce.description:
If `enableAce` is set to true and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive an ACE callback when the call is answered. When the callback is received, your platform must respond with a svamlet containing the `connectConf` action in order to add the call to a conference or create the conference if it's the first call. If it's set to false, no ACE event will be sent to your backend.
Note if the call is towards an InApp destination `type:` `username`, then no ACE will be issued when the call is connected, even if `enableAce` is present in the callout request.

enableDice.description:
If `enableDice` is set to true and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive a DiCE callback when the call is disconnected. If it's set to false, no DiCE event will be sent to your backend.
Note if the call is towards an InApp destination `type:` `username`, then no DICE will be issued at the end of the call, even if `enableDice` is present in the callout request.

enablePie.description: If `enablePie` is set to true and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive a PIE callback after a `runMenu` action, with the information of the action that the user took. If it's set to false, no PIE event will be sent to your backend.

locale.description: The voice and language you want to use for the prompts. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../../voice-locales/)

greeting.description: The text that will be spoken as a greeting.

mohClass.description:
Means "music-on-hold." It's an optional parameter that specifies what the first participant should listen to while they're alone in the conference, waiting for other participants to join. It can take one of these pre-defined values:
  • `ring` (progress tone)
  • `music1` (music file)
  • `music2` (music file)
  • `music3` (music file)

If no music-on-hold is specified, the user will only hear silence.

domain.description: can be either pstn for PSTN endpoint or mxp for data (app or web) clients.

ttsCalloutRequest.description: The text-to-speech callout calls a phone number and plays a synthesized text messages or pre-recorded sound files.

cli.description: The number that will be displayed as the incoming caller. To set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard number. The number must be in [E.164](https://community.sinch.com/t5/Glossary/E-164/ta-p/7537) format.

dtmf.description: When the destination picks up, this DTMF tones will be played to the callee. Valid characters in the string are "0"-"9", "#", and "w". A "w" will render a 500 ms pause. For example, "ww1234#w#" will render a 1s pause, the DTMF tones "1", "2", "3", "4" and "#" followed by a 0.5s pause and finally the DTMF tone for "#". This can be used if the callout destination for instance require a conference PIN code or an extension to be entered.

domain.description: Can be either `pstn` for PSTN endpoint or `mxp` for data (app or web) clients.

custom.description: Can be used to input custom data.

locale.description: The voice and language you want to use for the text-to-speech message. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../../voice-locales/).

text.description:
The text that will be spoken in the text-to-speech message.

_Every application's default maximum characters allowed in text-to-speech is 600 characters. Contact support if you wish this limit to be changed._

prompts.description:
An advanced alternative to using ```text```.

__TTS__ _Text To Speech:_ The equivalent of text but within the prompt property.

Example: _```#tts[Hello from Sinch]```_

__TTS with SSML__ _Text To Speech with Speech Synthesis Markup Language (SSML)._ This is an XML-based markup language for assisting the generation of synthetic speech in the Web and other applications. AWS Polly supports a sub-set of SSML. This allows us to use SSML-enhanced text for additional control over how Polly generates speech from the text. Details and examples of supported tags are [here](https://docs.aws.amazon.com/polly/latest/dg/supportedtags.html)

  __Externally hosted media:__ Provide a URL to your own hosted media.  Please check [here](../../../supported-audio-formats/#limits) to read about audio content type and usage limits.

_Every application's default maximum allowed in TTS or TTS SSML is 600 characters. Contact support if you wish this limit to be changed._
_Several prompts can be used, separated by a semi-colon_ ```;```

Example: _```#tts[Hello from Sinch];#ssml[<speak><break time=\"250ms\"/>Have a great day!</speak>]```_

enableAce.description: If `enableAce` is set to `true` and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive an ACE callback when the call is answered. When the callback is received, your platform must respond with a svamlet, containing the connectconf action in order to add the call to a conference or create the conference if it's the first call. If it's set to `false`, no ACE event will be sent to your backend.

enableDice.description: If `enableDice` is set to `true` and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive a DiCE callback when the call is disconnected. If it's set to `false`, no DiCE event will be sent to your backend.

enablePie.description: Note: PIE callbacks are not available for DATA Calls; only PSTN and SIP calls. If `enablePie` is set to `true` and the application has a callback URL specified, you will receive a PIE callback after the `runMenu` action executes and after the configured menu timeout has elapsed with no input. If it's set to `false`, no PIE events will be sent to your backend.

customCalloutRequest.description: The custom callout, the server initiates a call from the servers that can be controlled by specifying how the call should progress at each call event.

cli.description: The number that will be displayed as the incoming caller, to set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard virtual number, it must be in [E.164](https://community.sinch.com/t5/Glossary/E-164/ta-p/7537) format.

dtmf.description: When the destination picks up, this DTMF tones will be played to the callee. Valid characters in the string are "0"-"9", "#", and "w". A "w" will render a 500 ms pause. For example, "ww1234#w#" will render a 1s pause, the DTMF tones "1", "2", "3", "4" and "#" followed by a 0.5s pause and finally the DTMF tone for "#". This can be used if the callout destination for instance require a conference PIN code or an extension to be entered.

custom.description: Can be used to input custom data.

maxDuration.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the call will last.

ice.description:
You can use inline [SVAML](../../../svaml/) to replace a callback URL when using custom callouts. Ensure that the JSON object is escaped correctly. If inline ICE SVAML is passed, exclude *cli* and *destination* properties from the *customCallout* request body.

Example: ```"{\"action\":{\"name\":\"connectPstn\",\"number\":\"46000000001\",\"maxDuration\":90}}"```

ace.description:
You can use inline [SVAML](../../../svaml/) to replace a callback URL when using custom callouts. Ensure that the JSON object is escaped correctly.

Example: ```"{\"action\": {\"name\": \"RunMenu\",\"locale\": \"en-US\",\"menus\": [{\"id\": \"main\",\"mainPrompt\": \"#tts[ Welcome to the main menu. Press 1 for a callback or 2 for a cancel<\/speak>]\",\"timeoutMills\": 5000,\"options\": [ {\"dtmf\": \"1\",\"action\": \"return(callback)\"}, {\"dtmf\": \"2\",\"action\": \"return(cancel)\"}]}]}}"```

pie.description: Note: PIE callbacks are not available for DATA Calls; only PSTN and SIP calls. You can use inline [SVAML](../../../svaml/) to replace a callback URL when using custom callouts. Ensure that the JSON object is escaped correctly. A PIE event will contain a value chosen from an IVR choice. Usually a PIE event wil contain a URL to a callback sever that will receive the choice and be able to parse it. This could result in further SVAML or some other application logic function. Example: ```"https://your-application-server-host/application"```

svaml.instruction.description: Instructions allow an application to play a message or file, start recording, and various other tasks. For more information about instructions, see the [SVAML](../../svaml/) documentation.

svaml.action.description: The action that will control the call. Each SVAML object can only include one action.

SVAMLRequestBody.description: SVAML is a call control markup language. When a server receives a callback event from the Sinch platform, it can respond with a SVAML object to control the voice call. The following is an example of a SVAML object type and its contents.

instructions.description: The collection of instructions that can perform various tasks during the call. You can include as many instructions as necessary.

svaml.action.hangup.description: Hangs up a call. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../../docs/voice/api-reference/voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback or an [Answered Call Event](../../../docs/voice/api-reference/voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ace) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `hangup`.

svaml.action.continue.description: Continues to set up a call. Available to use in a response to an [Answered Call Event](../../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ace) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `continue`.

svaml.action.connectPstn.description: Determines how a PSTN call is connected. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `connectPstn`.

number.description: Used to override where PSTN call is connected. If not specified, the extension the client called is used.

locale.description: Specifies the locale. Uses the language code according to `ISO 639`, a dash (`-`), and a country code according to `ISO 3166-1 alpha-2`. If not specified, the default locale of `en-US` is used.

maxDuration.description: The max duration of the call in seconds (max 14400 seconds). If the call is still connected at that time, it will be automatically disconnected.

dialTimeout.description: The max duration the call will wait in ringing unanswered state before terminating with ```TIMEOUT/NO ANSWER``` on PSTN leg and ```NA/BUSY```on MXP leg.

cli.description: Used to override the CLI (or caller ID) of the client. The phone number of the person who initiated the call is shown as the CLI. To set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard virtual number.

suppressCallbacks.description: If enabled, suppresses [ACE](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ace) and [DICE](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/dice) callbacks for the call.

dtmf.description:
A string that determines the DTMF tones to play to the callee when the call is picked up.
Valid characters are: `0-9`, `#`, and `w`. `w` renders a 500ms pause. For example, the string `ww1234#w#`, plays a 1 second pause, the DTMF tones for `1`, `2`, `3`, `4`, and `#`, followed by a 500ms pause and finally the `#` tone.
This is useful if the callout destination requires a conference PIN code or an extension. If there is a calling party, it will hear progress while the DTMF is sent.

indications.description: The locale's tone to play while ringing.

amd.description: An optional property used to enable [Answering Machine Detection](/docs/voice/api-reference/amd_v2) (AMD).

svaml.action.connectMxp.description: Determines how an application-to-application call is connected. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `connectMxp`.

destination.description: Allows you to specify or override the final destination of the call. If the final destination of the call is not dialed, this is a required parameter.

x-enumDescriptions.number: A phone number on the PSTN.
x-enumDescriptions.username: The username of a contact in an application.

endpoint.description: The phone number or username of the desired call destination.

callheaders.description: An optional parameter that allows you to specify or override call headers provided to the receiving Sinch SDK client. Read more about call headers [here](../../call-headers/).

svaml.action.connectConf.description: Connects an incoming call to a conference. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `connectConf`.

conferenceId.description: The unique identifier of the conference. Shouldn't exceed 64 characters.

conferenceDtmfOptions.description: Options to control how DTMF signals are used by the participant in the conference. For information on how to use this feature, read more [here](../../conference-dtmf).

mode.description: Determines what DTMF mode the participant will use in the call.

x-enumDescriptions.ignore: Nothing is done with the participant's DTMF signals. This is the default mode. Any DTMF signals that the participant sends can still be heard by all participants, but no action will be performed.
x-enumDescriptions.forward: The participant's DTMF signals are forwarded to all other participants in the conference.
x-enumDescriptions.detect: The participant's DTMF signals are detected by the conference and sent to your backend server using a [Prompt Input Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/pie) (PIE) callback.

maxDigits.description:
The maximum number of accepted digits before sending the collected input via a PIE callback. The default value is `1`. If the value is greater than `1`, the PIE callback is triggered by one of the three following events:
  - No additional digit is entered before the `timeoutMills` timeout period has elapsed.
  - The `#` character is entered.
  - The maximum number of digits has been entered.

timeoutMills.description: The number of milliseconds that the system will wait between entered digits before triggering the PIE callback. The default value is `3000`.

moh.description: Means "music on hold". If this optional parameter is included, plays music to the first participant in a conference while they're alone and waiting for other participants to join. If `moh` isn't specified, the user will only hear silence while alone in the conference.

svaml.action.connectSip.description: Determines how to route a call to a SIP server. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `connectSip`.

destination.description: Specifies where to route the SIP call.

maxDuration.description: The max duration of the call in seconds (max 14400 seconds). If the call is still connected at that time, it will be automatically disconnected.

cli.description: Used to override the CLI (or caller ID) of the client. The phone number of the person who initiated the call is shown as the CLI. To set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard virtual number.

transport.description: An optional parameter to specify the SIP transport protocol. If unspecified, UDP is used.

suppressCallbacks.description: If enabled, suppresses [ACE](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ace) and [DICE](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/dice) callbacks for the call.

callHeaders.description: [Private SIP headers](../../sip-trunking/#receiving-calls-from-sinch-platform-to-your-sip-infrastructure) to send with the call.

moh.description: Means "music on hold". If this optional parameter is included, plays music to the connected participant if the SIP call is placed on hold. If `moh` isn't specified and the SIP call is placed on hold, the user will only hear silence while during the holding period .

svaml.action.runMenu.description: Plays an interactive voice response (IVR) menu to the callee. This menu can play pre-recorded files or text-to-speech messages, collect DTMF tones, and trigger the [Prompt Input Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/pie) (PIE) callback towards your backend, notifying you of the actions the callee took. Available to use in a response to an [Incoming Call Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ice) callback or an [Answered Call Event](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/ace) callback. Also be used in combination with the [Conferences](/docs/voice/api-reference/voice/tag/Conferences/#tag/Conferences) endpoint of the Calling API.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `runMenu`.

barge.description: 'Barging' means that the user can press a DTMF digit before the prompt has finished playing. If a valid input is pressed, the message will stop playing and accept the input. If `barge` is disabled, the user must listen to the entire prompt before input is accepted. By default, barging is enabled.

locale.description: The voice and language you want to use for the text-to-speech message. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../voice-locales). If using the `enableVoice` to enable voice detection, the `locale` property is required in order to select the input language.

mainMenu.description: Selects the menu item from the `menus` array to play first.

enableVoice.description: Enables voice detection. If enabled, users can say their answers to prompts in addition to entering them using the keypad.

menus.description: The list of menus available. The menu with the `id` value of `main` will always play first. If no menu has an `id` value of `main`, an error is returned.

svaml.action.park.description: Parks the call and places the caller on hold. The caller is placed into a loop, listening to an IVR prompt (either a pre-recorded audio file or generated by text to speech). If the call is unparked, prompts will stop playing immediately. If the max duration is reached, the last prompt will be fully played until the call ends.

name.description: The name property. Must have the value `park`.

locale.description: The voice and language you want to use for the text-to-speech message. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../voice-locales).

introPrompt.description: That prompt that is played when the call is first answered. You can use text-to-speech using the `#tts[]` element, SSML commands using the `#ssml[]` element.

holdPrompt.description: The prompt that is played on repeat until the call is unparked or the until the `maxDuration` value is reached. You can use text-to-speech using the `#tts[]` element, SSML commands using the `#ssml[]` element.
holdPrompt.example: #tts[Thank you for your patience, your call is very important to us.]

maxDuration.description: The maximum amount of time in seconds that the `holdPrompt` will be played.

svaml.instruction.playFiles.description: Plays Interactive Voice Response (IVR) files for the supported locale or SSML commands at the Sinch backend. An IVR message is played only on the caller's side.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `playFiles`.

ids.description: The IDs of the files which will be played. These can be a URL to a file, SSML commands using the `#ssml[]` element, or text using the `#tts[]` element.

locale.description: If using SSML or TTS, this is a required field. The voice and language you want to use for the text-to-speech message. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../voice-locales).

svaml.instruction.say.description: Plays a synthesized text-to-speech message to the end user. The message is provided in the text field.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `say`.

text.description: Contains the message that will be spoken. Default maximum length is 600 characters. To change this limit, please contact support.
text.example: Hello, thank you for calling Sinch!

locale.description: The voice and language you want to use for the text-to-speech message. This can either be defined by the ISO 639 locale and language code or by specifying a particular voice. Supported languages and voices are detailed [here](../../voice-locales).

svaml.instruction.sendDtmf.description: Plays DTMF tones in the call.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `sendDtmf`.

value.description:
A string that determines the DTMF tones to play to the callee when the call is picked up.
Valid characters are: `0-9`, `#`, and `w`. `w` renders a 500ms pause. For example, the string `ww1234#w#`, plays a 1 second pause, the DTMF tones for `1`, `2`, `3`, `4`, and `#`, followed by a 500ms pause and finally the `#` tone.
This is useful if the callout destination requires a conference PIN code or an extension. If there is a calling party, it will hear progress while the DTMF is sent.

svaml.instruction.setCookie.description: Creates a cookie for the duration of the call.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `setCookie`.

key.description: The name of the cookie you want to set.

value.description: The value of the cookie you want to set.

svaml.instruction.answer.description: Forces the callee to answer the call.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `answer`.

svaml.instruction.startRecording.description: Starts a recording of the call.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `startRecording`.

options.description: An object that specifies details about the recording. For more details, see [Recording Options](../../recording/#recording-options).

svaml.instruction.stopRecording.description: Stops the recording of the call.

name.description: The `name` property. Must have the value `stopRecording`.

menu.description: An IVR menu that contains an audio prompt as well as configured options.

id.description: The identifier of a menu. One menu must have the ID value of `main`.

mainPrompt.description:
The main voice prompt that the user hears when the menu starts the first time.

You can use text-to-speech using the `#tts[]` element, SSML commands using the `#ssml[]` element, pre-recorded messages, or URL references to external media resources. You can use multiple prompts by separating each prompt with a semi-colon (`;`). If multiple prompts are used, they will be played in the order they are specified, without any pauses between playback. For external media resources, you can use an `#href[...]` or directly specify the full URL. Check the [Supported audio formats](/docs/voice/api-reference/supported-audio-formats) section for more information.

repeatPrompt.description:
The prompt that will be played if valid or expected DTMF digits are not entered.

You can use text-to-speech using the `#tts[]` element, SSML commands using the `#ssml[]` element, pre-recorded messages, or URL references to external media resources. You can use multiple prompts by separating each prompt with a semi-colon (`;`). If multiple prompts are used, they will be played in the order they are specified, without any pauses between playback. For external media resources, you can use an `#href[...]` or directly specify the full URL. Check the [Supported audio formats](/docs/voice/api-reference/supported-audio-formats) section for more information.

repeats.description: The number of times that the `repeatPrompt` is played.

maxDigits.description: The maximum number of digits expected for a user to enter. Once these digits are collected, a [Prompt Input Event (PIE)](../../voice/tag/Callbacks/#tag/Callbacks/operation/pie) is triggered containing these digits.

timeoutMills.description: Determines silence for the purposes of collecting a DTMF or voice response in milliseconds. If the timeout is reached, the response is considered completed and will be submitted.

maxTimeoutMills.description: Sets a limit for the maximum amount of time allowed to collect voice input.

options.description: The set of options available in the menu.

option.description: A configured option that the user can trigger to perform an action.

dtmf.description: A DTMF digit the user can press to trigger the configured action.

action.description: Determines which action is taken when the DTMF digit is pressed.

callHeader.description: Call Headers can be used to pass custom data from a Sinch SDK client to another, or specified in an ICE response to be made available to the receiving client. Further, if Call Headers is specified they will be available in ICE and DICE events.

key.description: The call header key of the key value pair.

value.description: The call header value of the key value pair.

aceRequest.description: The request body of an Answered Call Event.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

custom.description: A string that can be used to pass custom information related to the call.

amd.description: If [Answering Machine Detection](/docs/voice/api-reference/amd_v2) (AMD) is enabled, this object contains information about whether the call was answered by a machine.

status.description: The determination by the system of who answered the call.

x-enumDescriptions.machine: An answering machine was detected as answering the call.
x-enumDescriptions.human: A human was detected as answering the call.
x-enumDescriptions.notsure: The system was unable to determine who answered the call.

reason.description: The reason that the system used to determine who answered the call.

x-enumDescriptions.longgreeting: If the greeting is too long, this could be indicative of an answering machine.
x-enumDescriptions.initialsilence: If there is an initial silence after the call is answered before the greeting starts, this could be indicative of an answering machine.

iceRequest.description: The request body of an Incoming Call Event.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

callResourceUrl.description: The path of the API resource.

custom.description: A string that can be used to pass custom information related to the call.

userRate.description: The rate that will be charged for the call established to the original destination. If the SVAML response specifies another destination, the same rate may not apply.

currencyId.description: The currency ID of the rate, for example, `USD`.

cli.description: The number that will be displayed to the recipient of the call. To set your own CLI, you may use your verified number or your Dashboard virtual number and add it to the `connectPSTN` SVAML response to the Incoming Call Event request.  It must be in [E.164](https://community.sinch.com/t5/Glossary/E-164/ta-p/7537) format.

to.description: An object containing information about the recipient of the call.

endpoint.description: The phone number, user name, or other identifier of the destination.

domain.description: The domain destination of the incoming call.

x-enumDescriptions.pstn: The call will be connected to a number in the PSTN.
x-enumDescriptions.conference: The call will be connected to a conference.
x-enumDescriptions.mxp: The call will be connected to a Sinch SDK client.

applicationKey.description: The unique application key. You can find it in the Sinch [dashboard](https://dashboard.sinch.com/voice/apps).

originationType.description: The origination domain of the incoming call.

x-enumDescriptions.pstn: If the incoming call comes the PSTN (a local phone number mapped to your application).
x-enumDescriptions.mxp: If the incoming call comes from one of the Sinch SDKs (iOS, Android, or Javascript) through a data connection.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

rdnis.description: The redirected dialled number identification service.

callHeaders.description: If the call is initiated by a Sinch SDK client, call headers are the headers specified by the *caller* client. Read more about call headers [here](../../../call-headers).

diceRequest.description: The request body of a Disconnected Call Event.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

reason.description: The reason the call was disconnected.

x-enumDescriptions.TIMEOUT: The call exceeded the configured timeout.
x-enumDescriptions.CALLERHANGUP: The caller hung up the call.
x-enumDescriptions.CALLEEHANGUP: The callee hung up the call.
x-enumDescriptions.MANAGERHANGUP: The call manager hung up the call.
x-enumDescriptions.NOCREDITPARTNER: No sufficient credit to make the call.
x-enumDescriptions.GENERALERROR: A non-specified error ended the call.
x-enumDescriptions.CALLBACKERROR: An error with the callback ended the call.

x-enumDescriptions.NOANSWER: The line called failed to answer.

custom.description: A string that can be used to pass custom information related to the call.

debit.description: An object containg currency and total amount charged for the call.

currencyId.description: The currency ID of the rate, for example, `USD`.

amount.description: The total amount debited for the call.

userRate.description: An object containg currency and rate per minute for the call.

currencyId.description: The currency in which the call is charged.

amount.description: The rate per minute that was charged for the call.

to.description: An object containing information about the recipient of the call.

endpoint.description: The phone number, user name, or other identifier of the destination.

duration.description: The duration of the call in seconds.

from.description: Information about the initiator of the call.

callHeaders.description: If the call was initiated by a Sinch SDK client, call headers are the headers specified by the *caller* client. Read more about call headers [here](../../../call-headers/).

applicationKey.description: The unique application key. You can find it in the Sinch [dashboard](https://dashboard.sinch.com/voice/apps).

pieRequest.description: The request body of a Prompt Input Event.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

menuResult.description: An object containing information about the returned menu result.

menuId.description: The ID of the menu that triggered the prompt input event.

type.description: The type of information that's returned.

x-enumDescriptions.Error: Returned if there's an error with the input.
x-enumDescriptions.Return: Returned when the event has been triggered from a `return` command.
x-enumDescriptions.Sequence: Returned when the event has been triggered from collecting DTMF digits.
x-enumDescriptions.Timeout: Returned when the timeout period has elapsed.
x-enumDescriptions.Hangup: Returned when the call is hung up.
x-enumDescriptions.InvalidInput: Returned when the value of the input is invalid.

value.description: The value of the returned information.

x-enumDescriptions.dtmf: The input is key presses of specified digits.

applicationKey.description: The unique application key. You can find it in the Sinch [dashboard](https://dashboard.sinch.com/voice/apps).

notifyRequest.description: The request body of a Notify Event.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

type.description: The type of information communicated in the notification.

custom.description: An optional parameter containing notification-specific information.

notifyErrorRequest.description: The request body of Notify Event notifying of an error.

type.description: The type of information communicated in the notification. Must have the value `callingerror`.

callId.description: The unique ID assigned to this call.

errorCode.description: The error code of the error.

errorMsg.description: The error message of the error.

user.description: The user ID that initiated the call.

custom.description: An optional parameter containing notification-specific information.

tags.name: Callouts
tags.description: A callout is a call made to a phone number or app using the API.

tags.name: Calls
tags.description: Using the Calls endpoint, you can manage on-going calls or retrieve information about a call.

tags.name: Conferences
tags.description: Using the Conferences endpoint, you can perform tasks like retrieving information about an on-going conference, muting or unmuting participants, or removing participants from a conference.

tags.name: Applications
tags.description: You can use the API to manage features of applications in your project.

tags.name: Callbacks
tags.description:
Controlling a call from your application backend is done by responding to callbacks from the Sinch platform and/or by calling REST APIs in the Sinch platform from your application's backend.

Read more about how callbacks work [here](/docs/voice/api-reference/callbacks).
